definition[0]: to try to make people admire your abilities, achievements, or possessions – used to show disapproval
example[0]: He couldn’t resist showing off on the tennis court.
definition[1]: to show something to a lot of people because you are very proud of it
example[1]: a picture of the restaurant’s owners showing off their award
definition[2]: if one thing shows off something else, it makes the other thing look especially attractive
example[2]: The white dress showed off her dark skin beautifully.
definition[3]: someone who always tries to show how clever or skilled they are so that other people will admire them – often used to show disapproval
example[3]: She’s a bit of a show-off.
